alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 1:03PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lamoille Creek...including Test - Lamoille, Lamoille... elevated river levels are forecast. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Bruneau River...including Rowland...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...ELevated creek levels caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs along the banks of Salmon Falls Creek. Water from Salmon Falls Creek begins entering the Salmon Falls Creek rest area along U.S. 93, about 3 miles south of Jackpot, NV. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 9.9 feet late Wednesday evening. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
